edu.uw.cs.cse461.service
Class EchoRPCService

java.lang.Object
  edu.uw.cs.cse461.net.base.NetLoadable
      edu.uw.cs.cse461.net.base.NetLoadable.NetLoadableService
          edu.uw.cs.cse461.service.EchoServiceBase
              edu.uw.cs.cse461.service.EchoRPCService
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetLoadableInterface, NetLoadableInterface.NetLoadableServiceInterface
public class EchoRPCService
extends EchoServiceBase

A simple service that simply echoes back whatever it is sent. It exposes a single method via RPC: echo.

To make a method available via RPC you must do two key things:

  1. Create an RPCCallableMethod object that describes the method you want to expose. In this class, that's done with two statements:
    1. private RPCCallableMethod echo;
      declares a variable that can hold a method description of the type the infrastructure requires to invoke a method.
    2. echo = new RPCCallableMethod(this, "_echo");
      initializes that variable. The arguments mean that the method to invoke is this->_echo().

  2. Register the method with the RPC service:
    ((RPCService)OS.getService("rpc")).registerHandler(servicename(), "echo", echo );
    This means that when an incoming RPC specifies service "echo" (the 1st argument) and method "echo" (the 2nd), that the method described by RPCCallableMethod variable echo should be invoked.

Author:
zahorjan

Field Detail

HEADER_KEY

public static final java.lang.String HEADER_KEY
Key used for EchoRPC's header, in the args of an RPC call. The header element is a string (EchoServiceBase.HEADER_STR).

Method Detail

_echo

public org.json.JSONObject _echo(org.json.JSONObject args)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
This method is callable by RPC (because of the actions taken by the constructor).

All RPC-callable methods take a JSONObject as their single parameter, and return a JSONObject. (The return value can be null.) This particular method simply echos its arguments back to the caller.

Parameters:
args -
Returns:
Throws:
